England schools to teach how to spot online fake news under government plans
content: The UK government announced plans to revise the national curriculum in England to teach students to identify extremist and deceptive online content. Education secretary Bridget Phillipson initiated the review to foster critical thinking following misinformation-related unrest after the Southport knife attack. Reforms are expected to begin in September 2025, aiming to protect children from disinformation.
summary: The UK government announced plans to revise the national curriculum in England to teach students to identify extremist and deceptive online content. Education secretary Bridget Phillipson initiated the review to foster critical thinking following misinformation-related unrest after the Southport knife attack. Reforms are expected to begin in September 2025, aiming to protect children from disinformation.

title: Dropped out to avoid becoming a 'distraction': US President Biden
content: US President Biden cited concerns about becoming a distraction for Democrats as the reason for halting his reelection campaign. He wanted to avoid causing harm to Democratic races and emphasized the need to prioritize defeating Donald Trump. Biden pointed out that maintaining democracy remained a critical issue while asserting that he faced no serious health problems.
summary: US President Biden cited concerns about becoming a distraction for Democrats as the reason for halting his reelection campaign. He wanted to avoid causing harm to Democratic races and emphasized the need to prioritize defeating Donald Trump. Biden pointed out that maintaining democracy remained a critical issue while asserting that he faced no serious health problems.

Muhammad Yunus acquitted in corruption case
content: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was acquitted in a second legal case on Sunday after Bangladesh's anti-corruption commission sought to withdraw prosecution. Yunus, along with 13 others, faced charges for misappropriating about Bangladeshi taka 25.22 crore from Grameen Telecom workers’ profit funds. Earlier, Yunus and Grameen Telecom officials were also cleared of labour law violations by a Dhaka tribunal.
summary: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was acquitted in a second legal case on Sunday after Bangladesh's anti-corruption commission sought to withdraw prosecution. Yunus, along with 13 others, faced charges for misappropriating about Bangladeshi taka 25.22 crore from Grameen Telecom workers’ profit funds. Earlier, Yunus and Grameen Telecom officials were also cleared of labour law violations by a Dhaka tribunal.

title: US pressure over St Martin’s Island led to exit, claims ‘Hasina’s letter’
content: A purported letter from former Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina suggests her removal after 15 years was due to US pressure over St Martin’s Island. The letter indicates her refusal to give up control of the island led to her ouster. Hasina, now in India, promises to return soon, denying allegations of student insults.
summary: A purported letter from former Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina suggests her removal after 15 years was due to US pressure over St Martin’s Island. The letter indicates her refusal to give up control of the island led to her ouster. Hasina, now in India, promises to return soon, denying allegations of student insults.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine's shock Kursk attack to pressure Russia and 'restore justice'
content: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy acknowledged Ukraine's incursion into Russia's Kursk region to apply pressure on Moscow's forces. The offensive led to evacuations and heightened security measures in Russia, with intense battles ongoing. Zelenskiy emphasized the move as a step to 'restore justice.' Despite reinforcement, the situation remains critical with injuries and significant damage reported.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy acknowledged Ukraine's incursion into Russia's Kursk region to apply pressure on Moscow's forces. The offensive led to evacuations and heightened security measures in Russia, with intense battles ongoing. Zelenskiy emphasized the move as a step to 'restore justice.' Despite reinforcement, the situation remains critical with injuries and significant damage reported.

title: Japan issues its first-ever 'megaquake warning'; know all about 'big one'
content: A 7.1 earthquake in southern Japan led to a warning from the Meteorological Agency about possible major quakes. Prime Minister Kishida canceled his Central Asian trip for earthquake preparedness. Experts predict a 70-80% chance of a major quake in the Nankai Trough. Earthquakes with a magnitude greater than 8 are classified as megaquakes.
summary: A 7.1 earthquake in southern Japan led to a warning from the Meteorological Agency about possible major quakes. Prime Minister Kishida canceled his Central Asian trip for earthquake preparedness. Experts predict a 70-80% chance of a major quake in the Nankai Trough. Earthquakes with a magnitude greater than 8 are classified as megaquakes.

Eiffel Tower evacuated after man climbs up ahead of Paris Olympics closing ceremony
content: The Eiffel Tower was evacuated due to a shirtless man climbing the tower before the Paris Olympics closing ceremony. The man was seen above the first viewing deck, near the Olympic rings. French authorities deployed over 30,000 police officers in Paris, with significant security around the Stade de France. The closing ceremony is scheduled at Stade de France at 9pm.
summary: The Eiffel Tower was evacuated due to a shirtless man climbing the tower before the Paris Olympics closing ceremony. The man was seen above the first viewing deck, near the Olympic rings. French authorities deployed over 30,000 police officers in Paris, with significant security around the Stade de France. The closing ceremony is scheduled at Stade de France at 9pm.
